channel.title: Combined Politepol Feed
channel.description: Merged feed from multiple Politepol sources

item.title: UK police says two British men arrested after train attack
item.description: British police said on Sunday that a knife attack on a train was not being treated as a terrorist incident and two British men had been arrested on suspicion of attempted murder. Officer John Loveless said of the nine people who were treated for life-threatening injuries on Saturday, four had been

item.title: Philippines, Canada sign pact on troops to deepen defence ties
item.description: The Philippines and Canada signed a pact on Sunday for their armed forces to train on each other's soil, boosting defence cooperation to tackle common security concerns in the Indo-Pacific region. Canada's first such deal in the region, the Status of Visiting Forces Agreement (SOVFA) takes to five

item.title: UK counterterrorism police investigate stabbings on train
item.description: Counterterrorism police are helping to investigate the stabbing of 10 passengers on a train in eastern England on Saturday in what the defence minister said appeared to be "an isolated attack". Police, who arrested two suspects when the train made an emergency stop at Huntingdon around 80 miles (1

item.title: UN chief calls for justice for crimes against journalists
item.description: United Nations Secretary-General António Guterres has said that journalists around the world face growing dangers while searching for the truth, including verbal abuse, legal threats, physical attacks, imprisonment, and torture. “Some are even killed,” he said in his message mar
